result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon L Taylor

records.addlTxt: Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Darrol E T.

Defendant Brandon L Taylor appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Brandon L Taylor. Student Intern Lukas Jaeger under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon L Taylor not in court.  Attorney Dean Douglas Sopcic appeared by video for Brandon L Taylor.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for pre-trial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report - 10-03-2022, filed.  rmm
Pretrial Services Violation Report - 09-27-2022, filed.  rmm
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brandon L Taylor appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz appeared by video for Brandon L Taylor. Attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. 
This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Darrol E T.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
